@description.name: @description
@description.body: Interface for creating the column visibility menu

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The menu which is displayed when this button is pressed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
item {String} One of the following strings, indicating what type of column-menu-specific object to instantiate:
menu
Instantiate a menu which will appear when the column visibility button is pressed. No options are provided in this case.
menu-button
Instantiate a button to correspond to a column within the table. The options are a map containing text, the name of the column; column, the column number; and bVisible, a boolean indicating whether this column is currently visible. The instantiated return object must implement interface {@link qx.ui.table.IColumnMenuItem}
user-button
Instantiate a button for other than a column name. This is used, for example, to add the "Reset column widths" button when the Resize column model is requested. The options is a map containing text, the text to present in the button.
separator
Instantiate a separator object to added to the menu. This is used, for example, to separate the table column name list from the "Reset column widths" button when the Resize column model is requested. No options are provided in this case.
@param.description:
One of the following strings, indicating what type of column-menu-specific object to instantiate:
menu
Instantiate a menu which will appear when the column visibility button is pressed. No options are provided in this case.
menu-button
Instantiate a button to correspond to a column within the table. The options are a map containing text, the name of the column; column, the column number; and bVisible, a boolean indicating whether this column is currently visible. The instantiated return object must implement interface {@link qx.ui.table.IColumnMenuItem}
user-button
Instantiate a button for other than a column name. This is used, for example, to add the "Reset column widths" button when the Resize column model is requested. The options is a map containing text, the text to present in the button.
separator
Instantiate a separator object to added to the menu. This is used, for example, to separate the table column name list from the "Reset column widths" button when the Resize column model is requested. No options are provided in this case.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map} Options specific to the item being requested.
@param.description: Options specific to the item being requested.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The instantiated object as specified by item.
@return.description: The instantiated object as specified by item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Empty the menu of all items, in preparation for building a new column visibility menu.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property menu. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #menu}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property menu. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #menu}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property menu. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #menu}.
